content.html:
Sunset at a botanical garden

Highlight of the week: picnic dinner and a sunset walk at the Bellevue Botanical Garden

Looking forward to: I’m planning another writing push this weekend ????????????

Stuff I did:

  • 2 hours consulting
  • 6 hours writing — I casually mentioned a plot issue to a friend and realized a character was an unnecessary holdover from the much longer previous version, then once I started looking at how to cut him out, I realized that another character was only there to bear weight for one plot point, so I’m trying to find a fix that’ll let me axe him too — when in doubt, cut it out! I am slightly concerned I’ve simplified the story to novella length, but tbh if that lets me finish the damn thing I guess that’d be ok ????‍♀️
  • 4 hours business development — looking like a new project will start soon!
  • baked sourdough blueberry nectarine cobbler — needed more filling, and also a 9×13 is too much dessert for two to get through, even having it for breakfast with yogurt several days
  • ordered some new sheets, which I’ve been meaning to do for ages, but the fitted sheet finally ripped and forced my hand ????
  • ordered a couple shirts and a pair of shorts — I dislike most of my wardrobe at this point since I bought it for the office and now I work from home, so I’ve been putting all the normal clothes in heavy rotation — what I *really* need is a new pair of jeans since mine just wore through, but I need to try pants on so I’m hoping to milk these till COVID numbers go down or I get my booster
  • did a freezer cleanout and tidy up ???? ❄????️
  • walked with a friend

Dinners:

  • knock off banh mi with air fryer tofu (inspo – just used tamari, oil and cornstarch) tossed in peanut sauce (inspo – subbed ginger and brown sugar and added lime juice) — were planning to make wraps but discovered mid-prep that we had no tortillas ???? — we were missing cucumber and cilantro but at least we had a substrate
  • cheesy tuna toast with olive relish ???? — dropped lemon juice to 1tsp in the relish and omitted pine nuts — light dinner for two, might want to double the tuna portion
  • sushi takeout: veggie and shrimp tempura + salmon avocado roll
  • Indian takeout: kathi rolls and pav bhaji
  • breakfast for dinner: fried eggs, toast and air fryer potatoes
  • salmon with dill cream sauce + brown rice
  • pigs in a blanket + coleslaw + lemonade

I think the cream sauce was a bit too rich because I had some (quite mild) phantom gallbladder pain, which apparently can be a thing for some time after removal. I’m six months out, and someone told me they experienced it for like 15 months after their surgery ????

Reading:

  • Read A Dawn with the Wolf Knight by Elise Kova
  • Started reading Decluttered by Jenny Albertini
  • DNF’d War with the Newts by Karel Čapek and Gamma Raiders: Storm Squadron Alpha by Calista Skye

Words I looked up / concepts I learned:

  • proxemics (via)
  • impecunious
  • adduce
  • synoptic
  • spatial justice

Pretty stuff I saw:

Monolith by Scott Listfield
  • Scott Listfield’s new show “Oh, Dystopia” — especially “Monolith,” I have been holding off on buying new art for a while but I would buy a print of that one! ????
  • East Wing by Adam Corbin Fusco
  • Silver-Spotted Skipper by Blue Aster Studio

New music I listened to:

  • New Release by Yacht (via Benji)

Website changes:

With a lot of help from Chris (thanks for sharing your code!) and some troubleshooting from the Homebrew Website Club crew, I set up a “series” to connect my contributions to the extended indie web social norms and connections conversation we’ve been having over the past year or so. (Rightly the series would include Sara and others’ contributions, but those are linked from each post so I suppose that’ll do for now.) I probably ought to create a landing page/post to introduce the collection, but to start the articles in the series have an added navigation box at the end of the post which links to the previous and next posts. I like framing these as a series, though they weren’t written with that intention, because the included posts were written over a long span of time, so linking them with nav connects my strain of thinking on this theme. Also, people who read the latest may have missed the earlier pieces.

Here’s the first article in the series. (The second article is better IMO but I decided to stick to chronological order.)
